member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.File.OpenTransacted(Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.KernelTransaction,System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.PathFormat)
member.summary: [AlphaFS] (Transacted) Opens a on the specified path using the specified creation mode, read/write and sharing permission, and buffer size.
member.param: The transaction.
The file to open.
A constant that determines how to open or create the file.
A value that specifies the operations that can be performed on the file.
A constant that determines how the file will be shared by processes.
A positive value greater than 0 indicating the buffer size. The default buffer size is 4096.

Specifies whether to use asynchronous I/O or synchronous I/O. However, note that the underlying operating system might not support asynchronous I/O, so when specifying true, the handle might be opened synchronously depending on the platform. When opened asynchronously, the BeginRead and BeginWrite methods perform better on large reads or writes, but they might be much slower for small reads or writes. If the application is designed to take advantage of asynchronous I/O, set the useAsync parameter to true. Using asynchronous I/O correctly can speed up applications by as much as a factor of 10, but using it without redesigning the application for asynchronous I/O can decrease performance by as much as a factor of 10.
Indicates the format of the path parameter.
member.returns: A on the specified path, having the specified mode with read, write, or read/write access and the specified sharing option.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.File.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the contents of a specified file with the contents of another file, deleting the original file, and creating a backup of the replaced file.
member.remarks: The Replace method replaces the contents of a specified file with the contents of another file. It also creates a backup of the file that was replaced.
If the and are on different volumes, this method will raise an exception. If the is on a different volume from the source file, the backup file will be deleted.
Pass null to the parameter if you do not want to create a backup of the file being replaced.
member.param: The name of a file that replaces the file specified by .
The name of the file being replaced.
The name of the backup file.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.File.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces the contents of a specified file with the contents of another file, deleting the original file, and creating a backup of the replaced file and optionally ignores merge errors.
member.remarks: The Replace method replaces the contents of a specified file with the contents of another file. It also creates a backup of the file that was replaced.
If the and are on different volumes, this method will raise an exception. If the is on a different volume from the source file, the backup file will be deleted.
Pass null to the parameter if you do not want to create a backup of the file being replaced.
member.param: The name of a file that replaces the file specified by .
The name of the file being replaced.
The name of the backup file.
to ignore merge errors (such as attributes and access control lists (ACLs)) from the replaced file to the replacement file; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.File.GetCompressedSize(System.String,Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.PathFormat)
member.summary: [AlphaFS] Retrieves the actual number of bytes of disk storage used to store a specified file.
member.remarks: If the file is located on a volume that supports compression and the file is compressed, the value obtained is the compressed size of the specified file. If the file is located on a volume that supports sparse files and the file is a sparse file, the value obtained is the sparse size of the specified file.

param.name: path
param.para: The name of the file.

member.param: Indicates the format of the path parameter(s).
member.returns: The actual number of bytes of disk storage used to store the specified file.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DiskSpaceInfo
member.summary:
Retrieves information about the amount of space that is available on a disk volume, which is the total amount of space, the total amount of free space, and the total amount of free space available to the user that is associated with the calling thread.
This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo
member.summary: Provides access to information on a local or remote drive.
member.remarks: This class models a drive and provides methods and properties to query for drive information. Use DriveInfo to determine what drives are available, and what type of drives they are. You can also query to determine the capacity and available free space on the drive.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Provides access to information on the specified drive.
member.param:
A valid drive path or drive letter.
This can be either uppercase or lowercase,
'a' to 'z' or a network share in the format: \\server\share

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.AvailableFreeSpace
member.summary: Indicates the amount of available free space on a drive.
member.returns: The amount of free space available on the drive, in bytes.
member.remarks: This property indicates the amount of free space available on the drive. Note that this number may be different from the number because this property takes into account disk quotas.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.DriveFormat
member.summary: Gets the name of the file system, such as NTFS or FAT32.
member.remarks: Use DriveFormat to determine what formatting a drive uses.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.DriveType
member.summary: Gets the drive type.
member.returns: One of the values.
member.remarks: The DriveType property indicates whether a drive is any of: CDRom, Fixed, Unknown, Network, NoRootDirectory, Ram, Removable, or Unknown. Values are listed in the enumeration.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.IsReady
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a drive is ready.
member.returns: if the drive is ready; otherwise, .
member.remarks:
IsReady indicates whether a drive is ready. For example, it indicates whether a CD is in a CD drive or whether a removable storage device is ready for read/write operations. If you do not test whether a drive is ready, and it is not ready, querying the drive using DriveInfo will raise an IOException.
Do not rely on IsReady() to avoid catching exceptions from other members such as TotalSize, TotalFreeSpace, and DriveFormat. Between the time that your code checks IsReady and then accesses one of the other properties (even if the access occurs immediately after the check), a drive may have been disconnected or a disk may have been removed.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the drive.
member.returns: The name of the drive.
member.remarks: This property is the name assigned to the drive, such as C:\ or E:\

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.RootDirectory
member.summary: Gets the root directory of a drive.
member.returns: A DirectoryInfo object that contains the root directory of the drive.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.TotalFreeSpace
member.summary: Gets the total amount of free space available on a drive.
member.returns: The total free space available on a drive, in bytes.
member.remarks: This property indicates the total amount of free space available on the drive, not just what is available to the current user.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.TotalSize
member.summary: Gets the total size of storage space on a drive.
member.returns: The total size of the drive, in bytes.
member.remarks: This property indicates the total size of the drive in bytes, not just what is available to the current user.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DriveInfo.VolumeLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets the volume label of a drive.
member.returns: The volume label.
member.remarks: The label length is determined by the operating system. For example, NTFS allows a volume label to be up to 32 characters long. Note that is a valid VolumeLabel.

member.returns: A drive letter as . When no drive letters are available, an exception is thrown.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyMoveProgressResult
member.summary: Used by CopyFileXxx and MoveFileXxx. The function should return one of the following values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyMoveProgressResult.Continue
member.summary:
PROGRESS_CONTINUE
Continue the copy operation.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyMoveProgressResult.Cancel
member.summary:
PROGRESS_CANCEL
Cancel the copy operation and delete the destination file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyMoveProgressResult.Stop
member.summary:
PROGRESS_STOP
Stop the copy operation. It can be restarted at a later time.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyMoveProgressResult.Quiet
member.summary:
PROGRESS_QUIET
Continue the copy operation, but stop invoking to report progress.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryEnumerationOptions.ContinueOnException
member.summary: Suppress any Exception that might be thrown as a result from a failure, such as ACLs protected directories or non-accessible reparse points.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryEnumerationOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Specifies whether to search the current directory, or the current directory and all subdirectories.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryEnumerationOptions.BasicSearch
member.summary: Enumerates the directory without querying the short file name, improving overall enumeration speed.
member.remarks: This option is enabled by default if supported. This value is not supported until Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DirectoryEnumerationOptions.LargeCache
member.summary: Enumerates the directory using a larger buffer for directory queries, which can increase performance of the find operation.
member.remarks: This option is enabled by default if supported. This value is not supported until Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7.

member.summary:
DDD_EXACT_MATCH_ON_REMOVE
Default.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DosDeviceAttributes.RawTargetPath
member.summary:
DDD_RAW_TARGET_PATH
Uses the targetPath string as is. Otherwise, it is converted from an MS-DOS path to a path.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DosDeviceAttributes.RemoveDefinition
member.summary:
DDD_REMOVE_DEFINITION
Removes the specified definition for the specified device.
To determine which definition to remove, the function walks the list of mappings for the device, looking for a match of targetPath against a prefix of each mapping associated with this device.
The first mapping that matches is the one removed, and then the function returns.
If targetPath is null or a pointer to a null string, the function will remove the first mapping associated with the device and pop the most recent one pushed.If there is nothing left to pop, the device name will be removed.
If this value is not specified, the string pointed to by the targetPath parameter will become the new mapping for this device.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DosDeviceAttributes.ExactMatchOnRemove
member.summary:
DDD_EXACT_MATCH_ON_REMOVE
If this value is specified along with , the function will use an exact match to determine which mapping to remove.
Use this value to ensure that you do not delete something that you did not define.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.DosDeviceAttributes.NoBroadcastSystem
member.summary:
DDD_NO_BROADCAST_SYSTEM
Do not broadcast the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message.
By default, this message is broadcast to notify the shell and applications of the change.

member.summary: Enumeration specifying the different reparse point tags.

remarks.para: Reparse tags, with the exception of IO_REPARSE_TAG_SYMLINK, are processed on the server and are not processed by a client after transmission over the wire.
Clients should treat associated reparse data as opaque data.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyOptions
member.summary: Flags that specify how a file or directory is to be copied.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyOptions.None
member.summary: No CopyOptions used, this allows overwriting the file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyOptions.FailIfExists
member.summary:
COPY_FILE_FAIL_IF_EXISTS
The copy operation fails immediately if the target file already exists.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyOptions.Restartable
member.summary:
COPY_FILE_RESTARTABLE
Progress of the copy is tracked in the target file in case the copy fails. The failed copy can be restarted at a later time by specifying the same values forexisting file name and new file name as those used in the call that failed. This can significantly slow down the copy operation as the new file may be flushed multiple times during the copy operation.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyOptions.OpenSourceForWrite
member.summary:
COPY_FILE_OPEN_SOURCE_FOR_WRITE
The file is copied and the original file is opened for write access.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyOptions.AllowDecryptedDestination
member.summary:
COPY_FILE_ALLOW_DECRYPTED_DESTINATION
An attempt to copy an encrypted file will succeed even if the destination copy cannot be encrypted.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyOptions.CopySymbolicLink
member.summary:
COPY_FILE_COPY_SYMLINK
If the source file is a symbolic link, the destination file is also a symbolic link pointing to the same file that the source symbolic link is pointing to.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.CopyOptions.NoBuffering
member.summary:
COPY_FILE_NO_BUFFERING
The copy operation is performed using unbuffered I/O, bypassing system I/O cache resources. Recommended for very large file transfers.

member.summary:
CALLBACK_STREAM_SWITCH
Another stream was created and is about to be copied. This is the callback reason given when the callback routine is first invoked.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.BackupFileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.remarks: This method will not backup the access-control list (ACL) data for the file or directory.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
Indicates whether the function will backup the access-control list (ACL) data for the file or directory.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.overloads: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.

The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.remarks: This method will not process the access-control list (ACL) data for the file or directory.

Specifies whether the function will restore the access-control list (ACL) data for the file or directory. If this is you need to specify and access when opening the file or directory handle. If the handle does not have those access rights, the operating system denies access to the ACL data, and ACL data restoration will not occur.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.BackupFileStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.BackupFileStream.Skip(System.Int64)
member.summary: Skips ahead the specified number of bytes from the current stream.

remarks.para: This method represents the Win32 API implementation of BackupSeek.

Applications use the method to skip portions of a data stream that cause errors. This function does not seek across stream headers. For example, this function cannot be used to skip the stream name. If an application attempts to seek past the end of a substream, the function fails, the return value indicates the actual number of bytes the function seeks, and the file position is placed at the start of the next stream header.

member.param: The number of bytes to skip.
member.returns: The number of bytes actually skipped.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ByHandleFileInfo.LastAccessTime
member.summary: Gets the time this entry was last accessed. For a file, the structure specifies the last time that a file is read from or written to. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory is created. For both files and directories, the specified date is correct, but the time of day is always set to midnight. If the underlying file system does not support the last access time, this member is zero (0).
member.value: The time this entry was last accessed.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ByHandleFileInfo.LastAccessTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets the time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), this entry was last accessed. For a file, the structure specifies the last time that a file is read from or written to. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory is created. For both files and directories, the specified date is correct, but the time of day is always set to midnight. If the underlying file system does not support the last access time, this member is zero (0).
member.value: The time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), this entry was last accessed.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ByHandleFileInfo.LastWriteTime
member.summary: Gets the time this entry was last modified. For a file, the structure specifies the last time that a file is written to. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory is created. If the underlying file system does not support the last access time, this member is zero (0).
member.value: The time this entry was last modified.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ByHandleFileInfo.LastWriteTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets the time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), this entry was last modified. For a file, the structure specifies the last time that a file is written to. For a directory, the structure specifies when the directory is created. If the underlying file system does not support the last access time, this member is zero (0).
member.value: The time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), this entry was last modified.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.MoveTo(System.String)
member.summary:
Moves a specified file to a new location, providing the option to specify a new file name.
Use this method to prevent overwriting of an existing file by default.
This method works across disk volumes.
For example, the file c:\MyFile.txt can be moved to d:\public and renamed NewFile.txt.
Whenever possible, avoid using short file names (such as XXXXXX~1.XXX) with this method.
If two files have equivalent short file names then this method may fail and raise an exception and/or result in undesirable behavior.
member.returns: A class with details of the Move action.
member.param: The path to move the file to, which can specify a different file name.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.MoveTo(System.String,Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.PathFormat)

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.Directory
member.summary: Gets an instance of the parent directory.
member.value: A object representing the parent directory of this file.
member.remarks: To get the parent directory as a string, use the DirectoryName property.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.DirectoryName
member.summary: Gets a string representing the directory's full path.
member.value: A string representing the directory's full path.

remarks.para: To get the parent directory as a DirectoryInfo object, use the Directory property.
When first called, FileInfo calls Refresh and caches information about the file.
On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.Exists
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the file exists.
member.value: if the file exists; otherwise, .

remarks.para: The property returns if any error occurs while trying to determine if the specified file exists.
This can occur in situations that raise exceptions such as passing a file name with invalid characters or too many characters,
a failing or missing disk, or if the caller does not have permission to read the file.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the current file is read only.
member.value: if the current file is read only; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Use the IsReadOnly property to quickly determine or change whether the current file is read only.
When first called, FileInfo calls Refresh and caches information about the file.
On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.Length
member.summary: Gets the size, in bytes, of the current file.
member.value: The size of the current file in bytes.

remarks.para: The value of the Length property is pre-cached
To get the latest value, call the Refresh method.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the file.
member.value: The name of the file.

remarks.para: The name of the file includes the file extension.
When first called, calls Refresh and caches information about the file.
On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.
The name of the file includes the file extension.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes
member.summary: Specifies how the operating system should open a file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.None
member.summary: If you pass , the set of attributes is unspecified. explicitly sets no attributes.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.ReadOnly
member.summary: The file is read only. Applications can read the file, but cannot write to or delete it.
member.remarks: Equals 1

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Hidden
member.summary: The file is hidden. Do not include it in an ordinary directory listing.
member.remarks: Equals 2

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.System
member.summary: The file is part of or used exclusively by an operating system.
member.remarks: Equals 4

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Directory
member.summary: The handle that identifies a directory.
member.remarks: Equals 16

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Archive
member.summary: The file should be archived. Applications use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal.
member.remarks: Equals 32

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Device
member.summary: The file should be archived. Applications use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal.
member.remarks: Equals 64

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Normal
member.summary: The file does not have other attributes set. This attribute is valid only if used alone.
member.remarks: Equals 128

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Temporary
member.summary: The file is being used for temporary storage.
member.remarks: Equals 256

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.SparseFile
member.summary: A file that is a sparse file.
member.remarks: Equals 512

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.ReparsePoint
member.summary: A file or directory that has an associated reparse point, or a file that is a symbolic link.
member.remarks: Equals 1024

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Compressed
member.summary: A file or directory that is compressed. For a file, all of the data in the file is compressed. For a directory, compression is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.
member.remarks: Equals 2048

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Offline
member.summary: The data of a file is not immediately available. This attribute indicates that file data is physically moved to offline storage. This attribute is used by Remote Storage, the hierarchical storage management software. Applications should not arbitrarily change this attribute.
member.remarks: Equals 4096

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.NotContentIndexed
member.summary: The file or directory is not to be indexed by the content indexing service.
member.remarks: Equals 8192

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Encrypted
member.summary: The file or directory is encrypted. For a file, this means that all data in the file is encrypted. For a directory, this means that encryption is the default for newly created files and subdirectories.
member.remarks: Equals 16384

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.IntegrityStream
member.summary: The directory or user data stream is configured with integrity (only supported on ReFS volumes). It is not included in an ordinary directory listing. The integrity setting persists with the file if it's renamed. If a file is copied the destination file will have integrity set if either the source file or destination directory have integrity set.
member.remarks: This flag is not supported until Windows Server 2012.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.NoScrubData
member.summary: The user data stream not to be read by the background data integrity scanner (AKA scrubber). When set on a directory it only provides inheritance. This flag is only supported on Storage Spaces and ReFS volumes. It is not included in an ordinary directory listing.
member.remarks: This flag is not supported until Windows Server 2012.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.OpenNoRecall
member.summary: The file data is requested, but it should continue to be located in remote storage. It should not be transported back to local storage. This flag is for use by remote storage systems.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.OpenReparsePoint
member.summary: Normal reparse point processing will not occur; an attempt to open the reparse point will be made. When a file is opened, a file handle is returned, whether or not the filter that controls the reparse point is operational. See MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.PosixSemantics
member.summary: Access will occur according to POSIX rules. This includes allowing multiple files with names, differing only in case, for file systems that support that naming. Use care when using this option, because files created with this flag may not be accessible by applications that are written for MS-DOS or 16-bit Windows.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.BackupSemantics
member.summary: The file is being opened or created for a backup or restore operation. The system ensures that the calling process overrides file security checks when the process has SE_BACKUP_NAME and SE_RESTORE_NAME privileges. You must set this flag to obtain a handle to a directory. A directory handle can be passed to some functions instead of a file handle.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.DeleteOnClose
member.summary: The file is to be deleted immediately after all of its handles are closed, which includes the specified handle and any other open or duplicated handles. If there are existing open handles to a file, the call fails unless they were all opened with the share mode. Subsequent open requests for the file fail, unless the share mode is specified.
member.remarks: Equals 67108864

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.SequentialScan
member.summary: Access is intended to be sequential from beginning to end. The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching.
member.remarks: Equals 134217728

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.RandomAccess
member.summary: Access is intended to be random. The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching.
member.remarks: Equals 268435456

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.NoBuffering
member.summary: There are strict requirements for successfully working with files opened with the flag, for details see the section on "File Buffering" in the online MSDN documentation.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.Overlapped
member.summary: The file or device is being opened or created for asynchronous I/O.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.ExtendedFileAttributes.WriteThrough
member.summary: Write operations will not go through any intermediate cache, they will go directly to disk.
member.remarks: Equals .NET -2147483648

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the state of the object.

remarks.para: FileSystemInfo.Refresh() takes a snapshot of the file from the current file system.
Refresh cannot correct the underlying file system even if the file system returns incorrect or outdated information.
This can happen on platforms such as Windows 98.
Calls must be made to Refresh() before attempting to get the attribute information, or the information will be outdated.

member.summary: Gets or sets the attributes for the current file or directory.

To get the latest value, call the Refresh method.

member.value: of the current .

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.CreationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the creation time of the current file or directory.

remarks.para: The value of the CreationTime property is pre-cached To get the latest value, call the Refresh method.
This method may return an inaccurate value, because it uses native functions whose values may not be continuously updated by the operating system.
If the file described in the FileSystemInfo object does not exist, this property will return 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time.

NTFS-formatted drives may cache file meta-info, such as file creation time, for a short period of time. This process is known as file tunneling. As a result, it may be necessary to explicitly set the creation time of a file if you are overwriting or replacing an existing file.

member.value: The creation date and time of the current object.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.CreationTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets the creation time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), of the current file or directory.

remarks.para: The value of the CreationTimeUtc property is pre-cached To get the latest value, call the Refresh method.
This method may return an inaccurate value, because it uses native functions whose values may not be continuously updated by the operating system.
To get the latest value, call the Refresh method.
If the file described in the FileSystemInfo object does not exist, this property will return 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

NTFS-formatted drives may cache file meta-info, such as file creation time, for a short period of time. This process is known as file tunneling. As a result, it may be necessary to explicitly set the creation time of a file if you are overwriting or replacing an existing file.

member.value: The creation date and time in UTC format of the current object.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.Exists
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the file or directory exists.

remarks.para: The property returns if any error occurs while trying to determine if the specified file or directory exists.
This can occur in situations that raise exceptions such as passing a directory- or file name with invalid characters or too many characters,
a failing or missing disk, or if the caller does not have permission to read the file or directory.

member.value: if the file or directory exists; otherwise, .

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.Extension
member.summary: Gets the string representing the extension part of the file.

remarks.para: The Extension property returns the extension, including the period (.).
For example, for a file c:\NewFile.txt, this property returns ".txt".

member.value: A string containing the extension.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.FileSystemInfo.Name
member.summary:
For files, gets the name of the file. For directories, gets the name of the last directory in the hierarchy if a hierarchy exists.
Otherwise, the Name property gets the name of the directory.

remarks.para: For a directory, Name returns only the name of the parent directory, such as Dir, not c:\Dir.
For a subdirectory, Name returns only the name of the subdirectory, such as Sub1, not c:\Dir\Sub1.
For a file, Name returns only the file name and file name extension, such as MyFile.txt, not c:\Dir\Myfile.txt.

value.para: A string that is the name of the parent directory, the name of the last directory in the hierarchy,
or the name of a file, including the file name extension.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Path.GetFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the absolute path for the specified path string.
member.returns: The fully qualified location of path, such as "C:\MyFile.txt".

remarks.para: GetFullPathName merges the name of the current drive and directory with a specified file name to determine the full path and file name of a specified file.
It also calculates the address of the file name portion of the full path and file name.
This method does not verify that the resulting path and file name are valid, or that they see an existing file on the associated volume.
The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0".
MSDN: Multithreaded applications and shared library code should not use the GetFullPathName function and
should avoid using relative path names. The current directory state written by the SetCurrentDirectory function is stored as a global variable in each process,
therefore multithreaded applications cannot reliably use this value without possible data corruption from other threads that may also be reading or setting this value.
This limitation also applies to the SetCurrentDirectory and GetCurrentDirectory functions. The exception being when the application is guaranteed to be running in a single thread,
for example parsing file names from the command line argument string in the main thread prior to creating any additional threads.
Using relative path names in multithreaded applications or shared library code can yield unpredictable results and is not supported.

member.param: The file or directory for which to obtain absolute path information.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Path.LocalToUnc(System.String)
member.summary:
[AlphaFS] Converts a local path to a network share path.
A Local path, e.g.: "C:\Windows" will be returned as: "\\MachineName\C$\Windows".
If a logical drive points to a network share path, the share path will be returned instead.

member.summary: Used by MoveFileXxx.Flags that specify how a file or directory is to be moved.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveOptions.None
member.summary: No MoveOptions used, this fails when the file name already exists.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveOptions.ReplaceExisting
member.summary:
MOVE_FILE_REPLACE_EXISTSING
If the destination file name already exists, the function replaces its contents with the contents of the source file.
This value cannot be used if lpNewFileName or lpExistingFileName names a directory.
This value cannot be used if either source or destination names a directory.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveOptions.CopyAllowed
member.summary:
MOVE_FILE_COPY_ALLOWED
If the file is to be moved to a different volume, the function simulates the move by using the CopyFile and DeleteFile functions.
This value cannot be used with .

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveOptions.DelayUntilReboot
member.summary:
MOVE_FILE_DELAY_UNTIL_REBOOT
The system does not move the file until the operating system is restarted. The system moves the file immediately after AUTOCHK is executed, but before creating any paging files.
Consequently, this parameter enables the function to delete paging files from previous startups. This value can only be used if the process is in the context of a user who belongs to the administrators group or the LocalSystem account.
This value cannot be used with .

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveOptions.WriteThrough
member.summary:
MOVE_FILE_WRITE_THROUGH
The function does not return until the file has actually been moved on the disk.
Setting this value guarantees that a move performed as a copy and delete operation is flushed to disk before the function returns. The flush occurs at the end of the copy operation.
This value has no effect if is set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveOptions.CreateHardlink
member.summary:
MOVE_FILE_CREATE_HARDLINK
Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.MoveOptions.FailIfNotTrackable
member.summary:
MOVE_FILE_FAIL_IF_NOT_TRACKABLE
The function fails if the source file is a link source, but the file cannot be tracked after the move.
This situation can occur if the destination is a volume formatted with the FAT file system.

member.summary: Provides information for the IQueryAssociations interface methods, used by Shell32.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitNoRemapClsid
member.summary: Instructs not to map CLSID values to ProgID values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitByExeName
member.summary: Identifies the value of the supplied file parameter (3rd parameter of function GetFileAssociation()) as an executable file name.
member.remarks: If this flag is not set, the root key will be set to the ProgID associated with the .exe key instead of the executable file's ProgID.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitDefaultToStar
member.summary: Specifies that when an IQueryAssociation method does not find the requested value under the root key, it should attempt to retrieve the comparable value from the * subkey.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitDefaultToFolder
member.summary: Specifies that when an IQueryAssociation method does not find the requested value under the root key, it should attempt to retrieve the comparable value from the Folder subkey.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.NoUserSettings
member.summary: Specifies that only HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT should be searched, and that HKEY_CURRENT_USER should be ignored.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.NoTruncate
member.summary: Specifies that the return string should not be truncated. Instead, return an error value and the required size for the complete string.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.Verify
member.summary: Instructs IQueryAssociations methods to verify that data is accurate. This setting allows IQueryAssociations methods to read data from the user's hard disk for verification. For example, they can check the friendly name in the registry against the one stored in the .exe file.
member.remarks: Setting this flag typically reduces the efficiency of the method.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.RemapRunDll
member.summary: Instructs IQueryAssociations methods to ignore Rundll.exe and return information about its target. Typically IQueryAssociations methods return information about the first .exe or .dll in a command string. If a command uses Rundll.exe, setting this flag tells the method to ignore Rundll.exe and return information about its target.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.NoFixUps
member.summary: Instructs IQueryAssociations methods not to fix errors in the registry, such as the friendly name of a function not matching the one found in the .exe file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.IgnoreBaseClass
member.summary: Specifies that the BaseClass value should be ignored.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitIgnoreUnknown
member.summary: Specifies that the "Unknown" ProgID should be ignored; instead, fail.
member.remarks: Introduced in Windows 7.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitFixedProgId
member.summary: Specifies that the supplied ProgID should be mapped using the system defaults, rather than the current user defaults.
member.remarks: Introduced in Windows 8.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.IsProtocol
member.summary: Specifies that the value is a protocol, and should be mapped using the current user defaults.
member.remarks: Introduced in Windows 8.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.InfoTip
member.summary: Corresponds to the InfoTip registry value. Returns an info tip for an item, or list of properties in the form of an IPropertyDescriptionList from which to create an info tip, such as when hovering the cursor over a file name. The list of properties can be parsed with PSGetPropertyDescriptionListFromString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.QuickTip
member.summary: Corresponds to the QuickTip registry value. This is the same as , except that it always returns a list of property names in the form of an IPropertyDescriptionList. The difference between this value and is that this returns properties that are safe for any scenario that causes slow property retrieval, such as offline or slow networks. Some of the properties returned from might not be appropriate for slow property retrieval scenarios. The list of properties can be parsed with PSGetPropertyDescriptionListFromString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.TileInfo
member.summary: Corresponds to the TileInfo registry value. Contains a list of properties to be displayed for a particular file type in a Windows Explorer window that is in tile view. This is the same as , but, like , it also returns a list of property names in the form of an IPropertyDescriptionList. The list of properties can be parsed with PSGetPropertyDescriptionListFromString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.ContentType
member.summary: Describes a general type of MIME file association, such as image and bmp, so that applications can make general assumptions about a specific file type.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DefaultIcon
member.summary: Returns the path to the icon resources to use by default for this association. Positive numbers indicate an index into the dll's resource table, while negative numbers indicate a resource ID. An example of the syntax for the resource is "c:\myfolder\myfile.dll,-1".

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.ShellExtension
member.summary: For an object that has a Shell extension associated with it, you can use this to retrieve the CLSID of that Shell extension object by passing a string representation of the IID of the interface you want to retrieve as the pwszExtra parameter of IQueryAssociations::GetString. For example, if you want to retrieve a handler that implements the IExtractImage interface, you would specify "{BB2E617C-0920-11d1-9A0B-00C04FC2D6C1}", which is the IID of IExtractImage.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DropTarget
member.summary: For a verb invoked through COM and the IDropTarget interface, you can use this flag to retrieve the IDropTarget object's CLSID. This CLSID is registered in the DropTarget subkey. The verb is specified in the supplied file parameter in the call to IQueryAssociations::GetString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DelegateExecute
member.summary: For a verb invoked through COM and the IExecuteCommand interface, you can use this flag to retrieve the IExecuteCommand object's CLSID. This CLSID is registered in the verb's command subkey as the DelegateExecute entry. The verb is specified in the supplied file parameter in the call to IQueryAssociations::GetString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.SupportedUriProtocols
member.summary: (No description available on MSDN)
member.remarks: Introduced in Windows 8.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.Max
member.summary: The maximum defined value, used for validation purposes.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes
member.summary: Shell32 FileAttributes structure, used to retrieve the different types of a file system object.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.LargeIcon
member.summary: 0x000000000 - Get file system object large icon.
member.remarks: The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.SmallIcon
member.summary: 0x000000001 - Get file system object small icon.
member.remarks: The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.OpenIcon
member.summary: 0x000000002 - Get file system object open icon.
member.remarks: A container object displays an open icon to indicate that the container is open.
The and/or flag must also be set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.ShellIconSize
member.summary: 0x000000004 - Get file system object Shell-sized icon.
member.remarks: If this attribute is not specified the function sizes the icon according to the system metric values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.Pidl
member.summary: 0x000000008 - Get file system object by its PIDL.
member.remarks: Indicate that the given file contains the address of an ITEMIDLIST structure rather than a path name.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.UseFileAttributes
member.summary: 0x000000010 - Indicates that the given file should not be accessed. Rather, it should act as if the given file exists and use the supplied attributes.
member.remarks: This flag cannot be combined with the , or attributes.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.AddOverlays
member.summary: 0x000000020 - Apply the appropriate overlays to the file's icon.
member.remarks: The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.OverlayIndex
member.summary: 0x000000040 - Returns the index of the overlay icon.
member.remarks: The value of the overlay index is returned in the upper eight bits of the iIcon member of the structure specified by psfi.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.Icon
member.summary: 0x000000100 - Retrieve the handle to the icon that represents the file and the index of the icon within the system image list. The handle is copied to the member of the structure, and the index is copied to the member.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.DisplayName
member.summary: 0x000000200 - Retrieve the display name for the file. The name is copied to the member of the structure.
member.remarks: The returned display name uses the long file name, if there is one, rather than the 8.3 form of the file name.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.TypeName
member.summary: 0x000000400 - Retrieve the string that describes the file's type.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.Attributes
member.summary: 0x000000800 - Retrieve the item attributes. The attributes are copied to the member of the structure.
member.remarks: Will touch every file, degrading performance.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.IconLocation
member.summary: 0x000001000 - Retrieve the name of the file that contains the icon representing the file specified by pszPath. The name of the file containing the icon is copied to the member of the structure. The icon's index is copied to that structure's member.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.ExeType
member.summary: 0x000002000 - Retrieve the type of the executable file if pszPath identifies an executable file.
member.remarks: This flag cannot be specified with any other attributes.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.SysIconIndex
member.summary: 0x000004000 - Retrieve the index of a system image list icon.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.LinkOverlay
member.summary: 0x000008000 - Add the link overlay to the file's icon.
member.remarks: The flag must also be set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.Selected
member.summary: 0x000010000 - Blend the file's icon with the system highlight color.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.FileAttributes.AttributesSpecified
member.summary: 0x000020000 - Modify to indicate that contains specific attributes that are desired.
member.remarks: This flag cannot be specified with the attribute. Will touch every file, degrading performance.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributesOf.CanRename
member.summary: 0x00000010 - The specified items can be renamed. Note that this value is essentially a suggestion; not all namespace clients allow items to be renamed. However, those that do must have this attribute set.

member.summary: 0x00000100 - The specified items are drop targets.

member.summary: 0x00002000 - The specified items are encrypted and might require special presentation.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Volume.DeleteVolumeMountPoint(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a Drive letter or mounted folder.
member.remarks: Deleting a mounted folder does not cause the underlying directory to be deleted.
If the parameter is a directory that is not a mounted folder, the function does nothing. The directory is not deleted.
It's not an error to attempt to unmount a volume from a volume mount point when there is no volume actually mounted at that volume mount point.
member.param: The Drive letter or mounted folder to be deleted. For example, X:\ or Y:\MountX\.

This field is valid for DFS roots only.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsPropertyFlags
member.summary: A set of bit flags that describe specific properties of a DFS namespace, root, or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsPropertyFlags.None
member.summary: No property flag.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsPropertyFlags.InsiteReferrals
member.summary:
DFS_PROPERTY_FLAG_INSITE_REFERRALS
Scope: Domain roots, stand-alone roots, and links. If this flag is set at the DFS root, it applies to all links; otherwise, the value of this flag is considered for each individual link.
When this flag is set, a DFS referral response from a DFS server for a DFS root or link with the "INSITE" option enabled contains only those targets which are in the same site as the DFS client requesting the referral. Targets in the two global priority classes are always returned, regardless of their site location.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsPropertyFlags.RootScalability
member.summary:
DFS_PROPERTY_FLAG_ROOT_SCALABILITY
Scope: The entire DFS namespace for a domain-based DFS namespace only.
By default, a DFS root target server polls the PDS to detect changes to the DFS metadata. To prevent heavy server load on the PDC, root scalability can be enabled for the DFS namespace. Setting this flag will cause the DFS server to poll the nearest domain controller instead of the PDC for DFS metadata changes for the common namespace. Note that any changes made to the metadata must still occur on the PDC, however.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsPropertyFlags.SiteCosting
member.summary:
DFS_PROPERTY_FLAG_SITE_COSTING
Scope: The entire DFS namespace for both domain-based and stand-alone DFS namespaces.
By default, targets returned in a referral response from a DFS server to a DFS client for a DFS root or link consists of two groups: targets in the same site as the client, and targets outside the site.
If site-costing is enabled for the Active Directory, the response can have more than two groups, with each group containing targets with the same site cost for the specific DFS client requesting the referral. The groups are ordered by increasing site cost. For more information about how site-costing is used to prioritize targets.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsPropertyFlags.TargetFailback
member.summary:
DFS_PROPERTY_FLAG_TARGET_FAILBACK
Scope: Domain-based DFS roots, stand-alone DFS roots, and DFS links. If this flag is set at the DFS root, it applies to all links; otherwise, the value of this flag is considered for each individual link.
When this flag is set, optimal target failback is enabled for V4 DFS clients, allowing them to fail back to an optimal target after failing over to a non-optimal one. The target failback setting is provided to the DFS client in a V4 referral response by a DFS server.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsPropertyFlags.ClusterEnabled
member.summary:
DFS_PROPERTY_FLAG_CLUSTER_ENABLED
Scope: Stand-alone DFS roots and links only.
The DFS root is clustered to provide high availability for storage failover.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsPropertyFlags.AccessBasedDirectoryEnumeration
member.summary:
DFS_PROPERTY_FLAG_ABDE
Scope: Domain-based DFS roots and stand-alone DFS roots.
When this flag is set, Access-Based Directory Enumeration (ABDE) mode support is enabled on the entire DFS root target share of the DFS namespace.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsTargetPriorityClass.DfsGlobalHighPriorityClass
member.summary: The highest priority class for a DFS target. Targets assigned this class receive global preference.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsTargetPriorityClass.DfsSiteCostHighPriorityClass
member.summary: The highest site cost priority class for a DFS target. Targets assigned this class receive the most preference among targets of the same site cost for a given DFS client.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsTargetPriorityClass.DfsSiteCostLowPriorityClass
member.summary: The lowest site cost priority class for a DFS target. Targets assigned this class receive the least preference among targets of the same site cost for a given DFS client.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsTargetPriorityClass.DfsGlobalLowPriorityClass
member.summary: The lowest level of priority class for a DFS target. Targets assigned this class receive the least preference globally.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.Connect
member.summary: Used by function WNetUseConnection(); Set of bit flags describing the connection. This parameter can be any combination of the following values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.Connect.None
member.summary: No Connect options are used.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.Connect.UpdateProfile
member.summary: This flag instructs the operating system to store the network resource connection. If this bit flag is set, the operating system automatically attempts to restore the connection when the user logs on. The system remembers only successful connections that redirect local devices. It does not remember connections that are unsuccessful or deviceless connections.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.Connect.Interactive
member.summary: If this flag is set, the operating system may interact with the user for authentication purposes.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.Connect.Prompt
member.summary: This flag instructs the system not to use any default settings for user names or passwords without offering the user the opportunity to supply an alternative. This flag is ignored unless is also set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.Connect.Redirect
member.summary: This flag forces the redirection of a local device when making the connection.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.Connect.SaveCredentialManager
member.summary: If this flag is set, and the operating system prompts for a credential, the credential should be saved by the credential manager. If the credential manager is disabled for the caller's logon session, or if the network provider does not support saving credentials, this flag is ignored. This flag is also ignored unless you set the "CommandLine" flag.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetConnectionEnum(System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle@,System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Lists all connections made to a shared resource on the server or all connections established from a particular computer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: If there is more than one user using this connection, then it is possible to get more than one structure for the same connection, but with a different user name.
Administrator, Server or Print Operator, or Power User group membership is required to successfully execute the NetConnectionEnum function.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetFileClose(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Forces a resource to close. This function can be used when an error prevents closure by any other means.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: You should use NetFileClose with caution because it does not write data cached on the client system to the file before closing the file.
Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute the NetFileEnum function.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetFileEnum(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle@,System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Returns information about some or all open files on a server, depending on the parameters specified.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute the NetFileEnum function.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetShareEnum(System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle@,System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about each (hidden) Server Message Block (SMB) resource/share on a server.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: For interactive users (users who are logged on locally to the machine), no special group membership is required to execute the NetShareEnum function.

For non-interactive users, Administrator, Power User, Print Operator, or Server Operator group membership is required to successfully execute the NetShareEnum function at levels 2, 502, and 503. No special group membership is required for level 0 or level 1 calls.
This function applies only to Server Message Block (SMB) shares.

Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: For all users, Administrator, Power User, Print Operator, or Server Operator group membership is required to successfully execute the NetShareEnum function at levels 2 and 502.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetShareGetInfo(System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a particular Server Message Block (SMB) shared resource on a server.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: For interactive users (users who are logged on locally to the machine), no special group membership is required to execute the NetShareGetInfo function.
For non-interactive users, Administrator, Power User, Print Operator, or Server Operator group membership is required to successfully execute the NetShareGetInfo function at levels 2, 502, and 503.
This function applies only to Server Message Block (SMB) shares.

Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: For all users, Administrator, Power User, Print Operator, or Server Operator group membership is required to successfully execute the NetShareGetInfo function at levels 2 and 502.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetServerDiskEnum(System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle@,System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The NetServerDiskEnum function retrieves a list of disk drives on a server.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: The function returns an array of three-character strings (a drive letter, a colon, and a terminating null character).
Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute the NetServerDiskEnum function on a remote computer.
Minimum supported client: Windows 2000 Professional [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows 2000 Server [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetDfsEnum(System.String,System.UInt32,System.Int32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Enumerates the Distributed File System (DFS) namespaces hosted on a server or DFS links of a namespace hosted by a server.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: No special group membership is required for using the NetDfsEnum function.
Minimum supported client: Windows Vista
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetDfsGetClientInfo(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a Distributed File System (DFS) root or link from the cache maintained by the DFS client.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: No special group membership is required for using the NetDfsGetClientInfo function.
Minimum supported client: Windows Vista
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetDfsGetInfo(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a specified Distributed File System (DFS) root or link in a DFS namespace.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.

remarks.para: No special group membership is required for using the NetDfsGetInfo function.
Minimum supported client: Windows Vista
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.MaxPreferredLength
member.summary: A constant of type DWORD that is set to 1. This value is valid as an input parameter to any method in section 3.1.4 that takes a PreferedMaximumLength parameter. When specified as an input parameter, this value indicates that the method MUST allocate as much space as the data requires.
member.remarks: MSDN "2.2.2.2 MAX_PREFERRED_LENGTH": http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc247107.aspx

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9
member.summary: Contains the name, status, GUID, time-out, property flags, metadata size, DFS target information, link reparse point security descriptor, and a list of DFS targets for a root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.EntryPath
member.summary: The Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path of a DFS root or link.

member.summary: The comment associated with the DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.State
member.summary: A that specifies a set of bit flags that describe the DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time-out, in seconds, of the DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.Guid
member.summary: Specifies the GUID of the DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.PropertyFlags
member.summary: Specifies a set of flags that describe specific properties of a DFS namespace, root, or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.MetadataSize
member.summary: For domain-based DFS namespaces, this member specifies the size of the corresponding Active Directory data blob, in bytes. For stand-alone DFS namespaces, this field specifies the size of the metadata stored in the registry, including the key names and value names, in addition to the specific data items associated with them. This field is valid for DFS roots only.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.SdLengthReserved
member.summary: This member is reserved for system use.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.pSecurityDescriptor
member.summary: Pointer to a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR structure that specifies a self-relative security descriptor to be associated with the DFS link's reparse point. This field is valid for DFS links only.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.NumberOfStorages
member.summary: Specifies the number of DFS targets.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_9.Storage
member.summary: An array of structures.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE
member.summary:
Contains information about a network resource.
The NETRESOURCE structure is returned during an enumeration of network resources.
The NETRESOURCE structure is also specified when making or querying
a network connection with calls to various Windows Networking functions.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE.dwScope
member.summary: The scope of the enumeration.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE.dwType
member.summary: The type of resource

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE.dwDisplayType
member.summary: The display options for the network object in a network browsing user interface.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE.dwUsage
member.summary: A set of bit flags describing how the resource can be used.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE.lpLocalName
member.summary: If the member is equal to or , this member is a pointer to a -terminated character string that specifies the name of a local device. This member is if the connection does not use a device.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE.lpRemoteName
member.summary: If the entry is a network resource, this member is a that specifies the remote network name. If the entry is a current or persistent connection, member points to the network name associated with the name pointed to by the member. The can be characters in length, and it must follow the network provider's naming conventions.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE.lpComment
member.summary: A that contains a comment supplied by the network provider.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NETRESOURCE.lpProvider
member.summary: A that contains the name of the provider that owns the resource. This member can be if the provider name is unknown.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.FILE_INFO_3.fi3_id

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.FILE_INFO_3.fi3_permissions

member.summary: Specifies which user (on servers that have user-level security) or which computer (on servers that have share-level security) opened the resource.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_200
member.summary: Contains the name of a domain-based Distributed File System (DFS) namespace.
member.remarks: This structure is only for use with the NetDfsEnum, NetDfsGetClientInfo, and NetDfsGetInfo functions.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_200.FtDfsName
member.summary: The name of a domain-based DFS namespace.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_300
member.summary: Contains the name and type (domain-based or stand-alone) of a DFS namespace.
member.remarks: The DFS functions use the structure to enumerate DFS namespaces hosted on a machine.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP with SP1 [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_300.Flags
member.summary: Value that specifies the type of the DFS namespace. This member can be one of the values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DFS_INFO_300.DfsName
member.summary: The name of a DFS namespace. This member can have one of the following two formats: The first format is: \ServerName\DfsName where ServerName is the name of the root target server that hosts the stand-alone DFS namespace and DfsName is the name of the DFS namespace. The second format is: \DomainName\DomDfsName where DomainName is the name of the domain that hosts the domain-based DFS namespace and DomDfsname is the name of the DFS namespace.

member.summary: A combination of values that specify the type of connection made from the local device name to the shared resource.

member.summary: The shared resource's permissions for servers running with share-level security.

member.summary: The local path for the shared resource.

DFS_STORAGE_STATE_ACTIVE

member.summary: No volume state.

member.summary:
DFS_VOLUME_STATE_OK

member.summary:
DFS_VOLUME_STATE_INCONSISTENT

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.Offline

DFS_VOLUME_STATE_OFFLINE

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.Online

DFS_VOLUME_STATE_ONLINE

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.FlavorStandalone
member.summary:
DFS_VOLUME_FLAVOR_STANDALONE
The system sets this flag if the root is associated with a stand-alone DFS namespace.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.FlavorAdBlob
member.summary:
DFS_VOLUME_FLAVOR_AD_BLOB
The system sets this flag if the root is associated with a domain-based DFS namespace.
member.remarks: Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions
member.summary: A set of bit flags that describe the permissions for the shared resource's on servers running with share-level security.
member.remarks: Note that Windows does not support share-level security. This member is ignored on a server running user-level security.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.None
member.summary: No permissions.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.Read
member.summary:
ACCESS_READ
Permission to read data from a resource and, by default, to execute the resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.Write
member.summary:
ACCESS_WRITE
Permission to write data to the resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.Create
member.summary:
ACCESS_CREATE
Permission to create an instance of the resource (such as a file); data can be written to the resource as the resource is created.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.Execute
member.summary:
ACCESS_EXEC
Permission to execute the resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.Delete
member.summary:
ACCESS_DELETE
Permission to delete the resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.Attributes
member.summary:
ACCESS_ATRIB
Permission to modify the resource's attributes, such as the date and time when a file was last modified.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.Permissions
member.summary:
ACCESS_PERM
Permission to modify the permissions (read, write, create, execute, and delete) assigned to a resource for a user or application.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.AccessPermissions.All
member.summary:
ACCESS_ALL
Permission to read, write, create, execute, and delete resources, and to modify their attributes and permissions.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes
member.summary: Contains information about the shared resource.

remarks.para: Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.None
member.summary: No specific resource type used.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.Dfs
member.summary:
SHI1005_FLAGS_DFS
The specified share is present in a DFS tree structure. This flag cannot be set with NetShareSetInfo.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.DfsRoot
member.summary:
SHI1005_FLAGS_DFS_ROOT
The specified share is the root volume in a DFS tree structure. This flag cannot be set with NetShareSetInfo.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.RestrictExclusiveOpens
member.summary:
SHI1005_FLAGS_RESTRICT_EXCLUSIVE_OPENS
The specified share disallows exclusive file opens, where reads to an open file are disallowed.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.ForceSharedDelete
member.summary:
SHI1005_FLAGS_FORCE_SHARED_DELETE
Shared files in the specified share can be forcibly deleted.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.AllowNamespaceCaching
member.summary:
SHI1005_FLAGS_ALLOW_NAMESPACE_CACHING
Clients are allowed to cache the namespace of the specified share.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.AccessBasedDirectoryEnum
member.summary:
SHI1005_FLAGS_ACCESS_BASED_DIRECTORY_ENUM
The server will filter directory entries based on the access permissions that the user on the client computer has for the server on which the files reside.
Only files for which the user has read access and directories for which the user has FILE_LIST_DIRECTORY access will be returned. If the user has SeBackupPrivilege, all available information will be returned.
member.remarks: This flag is supported only on servers running Windows Server 2003 with SP1 or later.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.ForceLevel2OpLock
member.summary:
SHI1005_FLAGS_FORCE_LEVELII_OPLOCK
Prevents exclusive caching modes that can cause delays for highly shared read-only data.
member.remarks: This flag is supported only on servers running Windows Server 2008 R2 or later.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.EnableHash
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_ENABLE_HASH
member.para: Enables server-side functionality needed for peer caching support.
Clients on high-latency or low-bandwidth connections can use alternate methods to retrieve data from peers if available, instead of sending requests to the server.
This is only supported on shares configured for manual caching (CSC_CACHE_MANUAL_REINT).
member.remarks: This flag is supported only on servers running Windows Server 2008 R2 or later.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareResourceTypes.EnableCa
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_ENABLE_CA (0X4000) - Enables server-side functionality needed for peer caching support. Clients on high-latency or low-bandwidth connections can use alternate methods to retrieve data from peers if available, instead of sending requests to the server. This is only supported on shares configured for manual caching (CSC_CACHE_MANUAL_REINT).
member.remarks: Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008, and Windows Server 2003: This flag is not supported.
